website_summaries.verdict: Undoubtedly the best of the best. This roller is worth the price thanks to its durable construction and consistent results.
pros: A top choice for its structured grid which promotes deep tissue massage and instant relief from tight muscles
cons: More expensive, but your body will thank you for the extra investment

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is expensive for a foam roller. But it's way better. I used a cheap foam roller and didn't understand why people swear by foam rolling in general. I'd use it for a couple of minutes and not notice any improvement in flexibility or pain. When I got this one, I got it: It's much firmer, so it actually causes your muscles to release tension. Pretty fantastic for everything below your neck. For lower back pain I love doing crunches with the roller in the mid-to-low back. It really releases tension there. Make sure you look up exercises targetting the areas you're working on. A good tool is nothing without knowing how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Very strong product
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, strong. Not spongie though - if you want a softer product, don't go for this one - probably need one with a foam center. I will need to use 2 different ones. This one is good if you're going to put a lot of weight on it because the foam centered ones would collapse or warp if you put too much weight on them (the cheaper ones from Walmart). So for rolling your back, this one is perfect. If you're going to roll your sides or T-band, way too hard - perhaps I can put a towel or spongie pad over it though for doing those. It will definitely last a long time. Overall I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Seashells

customer_reviews.title: Wake up & open your spine
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad back, and this roller is amazing. It opens the stretches my back every morning. I often wake up stiff, but after a few minutes of rolling when I first get up, I am flexible and ready to go! It comes with a cardboard guide to help you see what other uses/stretches/massage techniques are possible. I love this brand and this larger roller. I first bought the shorter one which was fine at first. After a while, I found that it was too much trouble to try to stay on it. With this larger one, I can roll side to side as I am rolling front to back. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: MiamiBeachDrew

customer_reviews.title: Best one
customer_reviews.text: So I looked at multiple review sites and this roller always got the top score. I assumed it was the usual marketing conspiracy/create your own review sites scheme. I bought 5 cheaper rollers, one after the other, and finally bought this one. Save yourself and buy this one first. Amazon basics high density foam rollers are my second choice, they are the best for the money. This roller is far and away the best for my nightmare IT bands, back and neck. It is the perfect balance of the hard non compressible core with a perfect amount of foam/texture overlay. The only ? is durability, but I suspect it will hold up better than the pure foam ones.
customer_reviews.author: pfw

customer_reviews.title: Gold Standard
customer_reviews.text: It feels like a quality product that will last and performs so much better than the standard black roller I was using before. It's super easy to use and target specific areas. It's so cool looking that even my 11 year old is into rolling now. I was hesitant to spend this kind of money on a roller but am so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Atlantic Bodyboard Shop

customer_reviews.title: Competitive price.
customer_reviews.text: This foam roller is ideal for certain types of trigger massages. It is the type that contains some softer foam material around a hard plastic cylinder. I think this is good to have in addition to a standard all foam roller. I also recommend watching some videos on the use of this product. It is not easy to use, especially if you have never foam rolled before. Comes with very limited instructions. The price is competitive with other vendors.
customer_reviews.author: pic100

customer_reviews.title: Only thing that has helped with back pain
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered from serious back pain since I was fifteen years old. This gives me better relief than any doctor or drug ever has. I won't claim its a miracle cure but for the cost, its worth a try from anyone who has similar pain problems. Beware of imitations. I have seen similar devices at retailers for a fraction of the prices but they don't have the deep grooves or the strength. This thing didn't budge in its center even after a 300lb relative used it.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorOnln9

customer_reviews.title: High-end and high-quality foam roller
customer_reviews.text: This is more than the average roller, but if you want to invest in something that's going to last and do a good job then this roller is worth the money. It's got the perfect amount of firmness, just enough ripple, and not too much absorption. The fact that it's hollow allows you to hold on to it on the sides and it's supposed to make it withstand time. I also like the green color inside and it's aesthetically pleasing: does not look bad in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have equipment for workout recovery
customer_reviews.text: I have been always wanting a TriggerPoint foam roller because of its unique grid. I was lucky to have found it on one of the daily deals on Amazon one day. I use this roller religiously after a long HIIT workout, running, and tennis. I have not experienced a cramp on my legs since. It relieves a lot of tight muscles including my IT band and calves. I will definitely be buying a smaller version for when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: it's a game changer
customer_reviews.text: if you like deep tissue massage with your foam rolling exercises, this is the product for you. my IT bands (in particular) were completely locked up and outside of a trip to the masseuse this was the only thing that helped. i would recommend upgrading to the 2.0 model for back rolling as the 13" version was difficult to align for me.
customer_reviews.author: yafman

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated leg cramps
customer_reviews.text: I have been running many miles each week and my calves have been tight. I stretch and do other exercises which help but my calves are still tight. I also had the issue of calf cramps at night. If I stretched out while sleeping, I would often get a cramp in the calf that was excrutiating. I have been using this on my lower legs each night. When I first started, it was a little painful but has gotten much better. The good news is my calves are not as tight and I have not had any leg cramps since I started using it. It was a really good purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone...
customer_reviews.text: It's well build, but actually caused more pain for me instead of relieving pain. If you can handle a very intense pressure, it may work well for you.
customer_reviews.author: Greensteves

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Like the design, the ridges provide a nice touch. Seems like it should last a long time. The cardboard packing has a good set of how-to use it and the website provides a lot of info/uses. One tip, don't destroy the plastic that it comes wrapped in because it makes a good cover to store it when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mendz

customer_reviews.title: They are amazing. I'm not a pro-athlete but this works wonders ...
customer_reviews.text: My gym (office) had one of these. They are amazing. I'm not a pro-athlete but this works wonders for post workouts, physical training, physical rehab, etc. I got the long one despite being petite as it allows two do more rolling (surface-wise). Also it is hard foam, under is a hallow tube. It is pricy but this will last me a VERY long time
customer_reviews.author: bbTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and works too!
customer_reviews.text: Took a roller class and learned how to use this before I purchased. It really helps to work out tightness and pain. There was only brief instructions but you cal always pull up youtube videos on how to use this furthur. A decent size and the nubs are perfect and do not stick out to where it is uncomfortable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Finnigan

customer_reviews.title: I feel so much better
customer_reviews.text: I started rolling my legs and I feel so much better. I was having knee and foot problems, and this really helps me stretch everything out. I guess I can't say for sure this model is better or worse than others, but it is the one my trainer recommended because it "holds its shape better than foam. For me it's been great and I would recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: KSo

customer_reviews.title: Hurts so good
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this I read reviews about it being too tough which almost made me not buy it. But ultimately I decided I want a roller that is firm enough to get out those tough knots; not some soft one that won’t apply any pressure. Love this roller. Enough so that I bought one for a buddy who started doing CrossFit. He said he likes it as much or better than the ones they have there. How much you like this product will depend on how much pressure/pain you can handle. My knots are pretty bad so when I use it for my back it’s a moderately tough feeing; but I know it’s doing it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Helped me get over a severe back spasm.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, it cracks my back when I rollover it which feels great for me. I don't know if that makes me weird but whatever. The fact that it doesn't compress through the center because of its rigid core gives it a very different feeling then the foam rollers that I used. I believe that this thing is going to last a really long time, it shows no signs of wear and tear so far even though it's gotten lots of use. The bumps and ridges don't seem to make much difference to me, but the softness and surface-texture are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: This didn't quite pop my back like I hoped I'd be able to use it for, I still like it. It's fairly heavy and feels very well built. I'm a very tall man and it didn't buckle a bit under my weight.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you workout a lot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I bought it because UFC gym in my area had them and it seemed to work great. I like that its solid on the inside and a little soft for comfort on outside. But this is great for rolling out knots and muscle stiffness. I have used others and they all were not that good. This is probably the best one I have used or even found.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my chiropractor. It really digs into those places that need special attention in a way that my other foam roller could not. This is very firm, the core is solid. I am keeping my previous foam roller as well, because I think there is a use for both. This feel like having a deep massage, and I am able to get rid of my back pain from using it.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Cadillac of Rollers
customer_reviews.text: Works great back issues are way better you can hear it crack like having a chiropractor at home. I bike a lot also so recovery time is faster when using roller on my legs. It really is the Cadillac of rollers. They use this roller on athletes like the NBA. Definitely would recommend for people with back issues I stopped goin to chiropractor. I tell everybody before goin to your lower back to work on the upper back in till you get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: norbert pacheco

customer_reviews.title: I could roll on this thing for hours
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST FOAM ROLLER OUT THERE!!! I am very active and I lift weights 5-6 times a week. I was forced to ease up on heavy weights due to persistent back pain. I did some research on the best foam roller for knots and persistent pain, and decided to give this one a try. It is AMAZING!!! It’s definitely firm, but it has worked WONDERS for my mobility and performance in the gym. I will warn you - you may bruise after using this roller (Maybe it’s just me, I tend to bruise like a peach). But I promise, it’s totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hayatt Ziboukh

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I was referred to this product by a friend. I was having neck and back trouble. I've been using the roller since I got it and I'm kicking myself for not buying this sooner. I've used my brother's All Foam Roller, this is much better. Although it is pricey, it's well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Trifl

customer_reviews.title: Solid Foam Roller
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this foam roller after I couldn't find the one I purchased 3 years ago from Amazon, and I'm under the impression this brand has a good reputation. So far, it's worked well. It's quite firm, and the outer covering is mostly uniform, which I like since I use this on my shoulders and upper neck on occasion. It's kind of a bummer the black-colored product is more expensive, but I can live with pink.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: The Best Foam Roller Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best foam roller ever!! By far!! Helps with pain, inflammation and muscle tension. I have purchased 4 other types& this one by far is worth the investment. I use it at the office, gym and at home. You can feel the difference when you use it. A must have !!
customer_reviews.author: Valette Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.  Best Foam Roller I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the most durable and beneficial foam roller I've owned. And I've owned about 3 others. One was very rigid foam. But this is nice and hard plastic under the softer cover, and it really allows you to perform manual myofasical trigger point treatment on yourself. I've had lat trigger points, rhomboid trigger points, infraspinatus, serratus, and on and on - and this allows you to literally kill them with your own mass and gravity. Worth it. Will buy another one to keep at work.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for home! So well made and super comfortable. Perfect size, height and padding to make the compression not painful but just enough to roll out your back, neck, sides and every leg muscle perfectly. Tried others and they squished down too much to be effective. This is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: RST

customer_reviews.title: Great Results
customer_reviews.text: My pain from multiple leg and hip injuries reduced immediately! This is a must have especially if you have old injuries that are causing new problems. This is a great product to use in conjunction with PT. I cannot go a day without using it.
customer_reviews.author: Juli

customer_reviews.title: Over rated but better than the plain styrofoam ones.
customer_reviews.text: This feels like it's going to be more durable than the pain jane black foam rollers. Solid build quality. It seems a little overrated since the pattern on the roller is hard to feel when you are actually using it. I weigh about 170lb so maybe if you're lighter you'd get more out of the grid pattern. The length is perfect for me and feels great nonetheless. Not the best value since it's just a tube but it's a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan D

customer_reviews.title: Nice but slight damage on foam
customer_reviews.text: Received with slight damage on the foam, I hope I won’t have a problem of it ripping more. It seems real good, This is my 3rd TriggerPoint foam roller, I bought the 12” for travel & 18” Grey foam medium & now the 26” Firm, I have been happy so far, They have Good Quality products
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great for your back
customer_reviews.text: This roller is a good size for use in un-kinking your back, hips, and other major parts of your body. It takes a little bit of use to get comfortable with it and it can hurt a bit if you position yourself poorly, BUT, it will iron you out and help with kinks and hitches you may develop.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate yet $45. Two padded PVC pipes which cant hold together
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Slightly firmer than the actual foam rollers. Cons: - This rubbish keeps separating becoming wobbly, uneven, and even splitting apart. Impression: Buy the cheaper foam rollers. The reliability of the foam rollers make those superior to these GRID rollers/pvc pipes
customer_reviews.author: Non-Racist Southerner

customer_reviews.title: less than expected
customer_reviews.text: we had high hopes for this product but we ended up with bruises and addition muscles strains
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Best large foam roller for a big man!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned 27 phone rollers in my life and this is by far the best one I’ve ever used exclamation I’m approximately 6 foot four and 3 inches in this bad boy covers all of my back and my large gluteus maximus. It’s also soft and hard and it’s able to get deep down into myofascial release!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jamal

customer_reviews.title: The perfect amount of texture and pressure for my needs
customer_reviews.text: The perfect amount of texture and pressure for my needs! Soooo many excellent uses for this durable, high-quality product. There are many on the market, so I found myself doing quite a bit of research. I believe I've found the ideal product for my and my husband's needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love this foam roller!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this foam roller. These are the high quality ones used at Equinox and I liked it so much I ordered one for home. This is great after a work out, driving all day, or even first thing in the morning after waking up. I use this daily and my back feels amazing afterwards. I recommend this to all my friends when they see it in my house.
customer_reviews.author: jCrew21

customer_reviews.title: More aggressive than the foam ones
customer_reviews.text: Upon my first use I thought this product was ok. It’s more aggressive than the all foam rollers I’m used to. Because of the metal cylinder under kind of a light cover of foam, it’s definitely harder than the all foam ones.
customer_reviews.author: AA (Amazon's Anonymous)

customer_reviews.title: I don't know about this one..
customer_reviews.text: I am not a roller pro, this was rated as one of the best but wow it is so hard and it hurts in all the places. The divot pattern doesn't help. Not to mention it's short in length. I am familiar with the foam type that's more giving and need to go back to that I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Barrington

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lotttt of different foam rollers over the years and this is by far the best one. My boyfriend has had his (the shorter version) for over 5 years and it's held up so well- we still use it all the time. So good!
customer_reviews.author: sof

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for getting rid of muscle tension
customer_reviews.text: This is AWESOME! I have a foam roller that has been a lifesaver in getting rid of the knots and tension in my body, but the foam was breaking down and it didn't provide as much pressure as needed. They had one of these in the chiropractor's office and I tried it out - it's great! If you use a roller often (I try to use it every day), it is worth the investment. It's very sturdy and feels great when you roll on it. I got a short version of another kind that was bumpier than this one (because it was cheaper), but it's almost impossible to use. This design is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: My Husband Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for one of these for me and my husband since the ones at the local gym look all nasty and the thought of a bunch of sweaty people using a foam roller just made my skin crawl. Now we have our own and can foam roll in the comfort of our own apartment :)
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice Roller!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 61 years old and never used a roller until I bought this one. Now I use it everyday at the gym during my warm up, combining rolling with yoga. As I see it, there is benefit from doing rolling that you can't get any other way. And I like the stronger internal structure of this roller and the ridges are not there just for looks, but seem to add to the massaging action.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Betcher

customer_reviews.title: One of the best foam rollers
customer_reviews.text: This foam roller succeeds on all levels. Pressure point / trigger point areas really help dig into problem areas and massage out sore muscles. Very well built. Better then any other foam roller I've tried in the past. Would definitely recommend! Bough one for myself and one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: DocEZ

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after using the same brand at my gym. I like the longer length to get my whole back. I also use it for push ups and other stretches. The roller is firm, but the squishy grooves help massage your back. I was going to buy directly from the website but would’ve had to pay shipping. I’m glad I found it on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ShoeAficionado

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: First time I tried at a physiotherapist place. Initially I was skeptical if it helps. However after several times of using TriggerPoint roller I felt difference. So, I decided to buy for myself 26’’ size. It is much more convenient to use 26’’ vs. 13’’. Now I use it on frequently basis to relief trigger points after running. At first it might be occurred to use by moving back and forth but after several usages I found my way of doing and it helps. I would recommend this product to buy and use.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: If you have hypertrophy pain, this roller will work wonders. After a good squats day, I usually have some pretty good knots in my quads right above my knees, and this roller helps work those knots out very well. It's great for back, and other areas too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time on other foam rollers
customer_reviews.text: Had this for years now and still use it regularly. Quality is great and perfect for relieving soreness and using for stretching.
customer_reviews.author: gymcat

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a very physical job so it is not rare for him to come home with a sore back. We first tried this product at his brother's house and he LOVED it. So easy to stretch out the muscles and pop his back without hurting himself. I bought one for our house not long after and now we've even got his dad using it too. They love this thing. Btw none of them are small guys (think 250-275 range) and this roller supports them with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Ray

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: this is the best roller I have ever tried. It gets all the trigger points and knots I have in my body. It is a good type of pain. This plus our shoulder and neck massager is what helps me deal with my daily pain. My dad loved it as well as he works in construction all day. This is definitely a must buy if your are looking for a good roller.
customer_reviews.author: Mireya

customer_reviews.title: Happy Muscles
customer_reviews.text: I love my foam roller. Helps my muscles recover with its firm padding. The foam roll is made with great material and is very durable. I use my foam roller very often for the past 2 years and the padding is still in great shape. The only thing is that I didn't receive a 26" roll but a 13" roll. I was super disappointed with this but I didn't want to wait any longer to use the foam roller. Make sure you are sent the correct size foam roll during your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kawika

customer_reviews.title: Superior product!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments I've ever made. Expensive but worth it to buy the name brand version! My back feels INCREDIBLE after every time I use it. Truly like giving yourself a back massage and gets all the kinks out! Also I feel revitalized and energized after I use it!
customer_reviews.author: 9e

customer_reviews.title: Tough Love
customer_reviews.text: This thing gives you some tough love! Be aware, you will be gritting your teeth when you release those tight quads/hams but its SO WORTH IT! I feel so much more mobile in my legs after a quick 15 minute rolling session. Product itself: The orange foam in the outside is soft but sturdy and always returns its shape. I wouldn’t want to be foam rolling on rocks. The black interior is like a super hard PVC pipe. No worries, it won’t break when your rolling.
customer_reviews.author: daboy444

customer_reviews.title: For my back pain
customer_reviews.text: I have back pain and I use this for my back pain, after I got off work I use this to roll my back ,I can’t say it works for back pain but you feel better after you rolled this !
customer_reviews.author: Jian chen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for my back! I use it daily and miss it when I do not. It could travel in a car but not on a plane as it is quite big. Do your back a favor and buy one today. The extra price is worth it over the foam types.
customer_reviews.author: zach holly

customer_reviews.title: Bedt foam roller by far.
customer_reviews.text: The best foam roller on the market. I tell everyone about these. Very painful to use for the first few months, in my experience, but if you ease into it and stick with it, they're awesome. And they don't get all compressed and mushed up over time like solid foam rollers. I tried these at my gym before purchase and was able to compare them to a few different kinds -triggerpoint was far and away the best. Also I think this longer roller is well worth the extra expense over the shorter ones.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my trainer
customer_reviews.text: My trainer has one like this, but his is green. I prefer the orange! It is the best foam roller I have had personally and you can tell it is super high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Philip D Hixon

customer_reviews.title: Without a doubt the best foam roller I’ve ever experienced
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt the best foam roller I’ve ever experienced. My high end gym, Lifetime Fitness has the same foam rollers. Hands down the best! It gets into the hard to get at spots.
customer_reviews.author: Rezonator

customer_reviews.title: Kind of big for travel but works great for bigger guys
customer_reviews.text: I am a 300lb man and this seems extremely sturdy when I am rolling my upper back on it. If you are looking for something, this product will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Well made, a daily user
customer_reviews.text: so easy to use, while making phone calls, watching the sunset, everyone should have one. A bit big for traveling, but the build quality is first rate.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product for serious muscle imbalances. Owned for over five years. Saved me countless times from many tight muscle imbalances. Mainly due to side sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: As a fitness and health professional and somebody who has very high standards when it comes to quality and functionality, I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: RN, PT, certified PERSONAL TRAINER, ACSM, NSCA, ACE

customer_reviews.title: Expensive But Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: There are many foam rollers on the market and I've tried quite a few of them. However, after trying my friend's Trigger Point I fell in love. I've had lower back pain from a ruptured disc since Feb '13 and this is the only tool (besides ritualistic stretching) that really helps alleviate my sciatica. This foam roller feels extremely durable. I am confident I will have this foam roller for decades to come. If you're serious about running, weight lifting, or just keeping your muscles loose, this should be your go-to foam roller.
customer_reviews.author: Ad@m

customer_reviews.title: Best Roller I’ve Owned
customer_reviews.text: I don’t travel with this nor would I but man is it great for daily back rolls after my swims. I love this thing I think it’s my favorite thing I own!
customer_reviews.author: Honest P

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: They had this brand at lifetime fitness where we go to the gym so we purchased this one we wanted a full length roller for covering the whole back. We are very happy. The roller is stiff enough to crack my husbands back when he uses it!
customer_reviews.author: ecurranrx

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Use this multiple times a week after spinning, running and boot camp classes (sometimes before). It is definitely more comfortable (not less effective though) to use than the hard solid foam one we own.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I use to use the smaller one but having a long one is much better overall! (For me anyways) Easy to use, very sturdy, and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: JazzieMeow

customer_reviews.title: Great relief for thoracic and lumbar
customer_reviews.text: This roller has been a lifesaver for me! This is the only way I’ve found to open my shoulders and work the glut/thigh area.
customer_reviews.author: FlyF9

customer_reviews.title: I love this Roller
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my home and feel this is much better than the foam rollers I used in the gym. It's definitely harder and doesn't give like the foam rollers do. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for active yoga user. They seem to really enjoy it! Have remarked several times how much they enjoy and how it helps with pain. Does leave marks on back sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Leigh Hanna

customer_reviews.title: This. feels. so. ...goooooood.
customer_reviews.text: This. feels. so. ...goooooood. I love this because it really massages the muscles deeply and it cracks my back right where it needs cracked. It is a fantastic product. I keep it near my TV and use it a few times a week. Incredible stress relief. Highly recommend because the padding is in exactly the right places. Very well made. Will last my lifetime for sure.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief
customer_reviews.text: Use this after workouts or during if needed to help reduce pain on muscles and joints. Have only had a short period of time but seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Back pain relief
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason videos for correct use are included...to get the most relief with this roller instructions are invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Reader

customer_reviews.title: Firm effective roller.
customer_reviews.text: I love this roller. Sturdy and firm. Has been and I use it mainly our lower back’s and IT band. It helps a lot. I’m very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Cbell

customer_reviews.title: Hurts so good!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this roller for over five years and it gets used almost every night. That should speak volumes to the quality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Like a deep tissue massage.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for working out knots in the muscles. Feels like a deep tissue massage. Very versatile. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Badie

customer_reviews.title: Chiropractor recommended
customer_reviews.text: My chiropractor told me to get this so I could help myself in between appointments. It works so great, even my kids are using it. Very satisfying to work out the kinks in my upper back.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B

customer_reviews.title: A solid foam roller for recovery
customer_reviews.text: It’s good size and solid roller we have been using post workout recovery. Much better than the cheap ones out there. Will recommend for tall people.
customer_reviews.author: av8r_home

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: It helps me warm up and release seizing muscles. Great to have around if you are doing any kind of strenuous exercise routine.
customer_reviews.author: Devi808

customer_reviews.title: Get this for you health, right meow!
customer_reviews.text: It does wonders for the back since I sit in front of the computer a lot. Great for healing muscles after workouts as well. Feel an immediate improvement after a roll.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy D

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much more than a traditional foam foam roller. Since it has ridges, it gets the places I need it to, with less pain than a hard roller.
customer_reviews.author: LORI

customer_reviews.title: Good Design and Well-Constructed
customer_reviews.text: The gym at which I exercise has several of these as well as other brands of rollers on the floor. After trying them all, I kept coming back to this brand / model. Decided to buy one for use at home. A little pricey, but considering the durability of the product, I won't need to replace it for a VERY long time, if at all so definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Randyinnewyork

customer_reviews.title: Great foam roller for stress!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday..several times a day. First came across this in one of my Pilates classes and loved it so much looked it up online and bought one for the house. It is great at working out the knots and tension in my shoulders and upper back as well as working your IT band in your legs and your calves. I did not get the link to the free online video but since I already knew how to use it I didn't make a fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Soraya Chandrakuar

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! It’s helped tremendously with my back pain. I Didn’t like it at first but after trying it 4-5 times I started liking it. Now I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Shana W.

customer_reviews.title: Great muscle relief for tightness
customer_reviews.text: I began using one of these in my gym and found it relieves my muscle tightness especially in my hips and legs. So, I love having one at home. The on line videos are super helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Painful? No way!
customer_reviews.text: I was all ready for a painful experience - and it never happened! I feel cheated!!! Actually, the roller is a great addition to some of the other strategies I use to stay ahead of the painful experience. The length of the 2.0 makes it much easier to stay focused on rolling rather than making constant readjustments. Should've made this purchase sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Ensign Chekov

customer_reviews.title: This one looks like it will last for a long time and withstand ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for hubby after the other one i purchased (another cheap brand whose manufacture doesn't stand behind their product) lasted only a couple of months, becoming deformed and flattened with each use. This one looks like it will last for a long time and withstand plenty of use. SO far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Curly Sport

customer_reviews.title: NICE!
customer_reviews.text: VERY NICE FOR ME...MIGHT BE A LITTLE STIFF FOR SOMEONE WITH A FRIGLE UPPER AGED BODY, BUT I LIKE.
customer_reviews.author: Carl B. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great for 250+lb users
customer_reviews.text: Pro: works great for users over 250+ lbs. It doesn't bend or warp unlike cheaper brands that claim they have a 300+lb weight capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie D.

customer_reviews.title: Feels so good to my back!!
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic back pain and this roller really helps! I feel like it us really worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: donna yates

customer_reviews.title: Not too hard, not too soft
customer_reviews.text: GRID roller falls right in the middle of soft and hard and will most likely soften over time. Great way to roll your kinks out, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: internet surfer

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and best roller out there!!!! It’s even hands down the best roller I have come across even at my CrossFit gyms and other gyms!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly11Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy with the right amount of cushion.  Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great job of hitting various trigger points in my back. More of a lower lumbar device but still want this in my house for stretching out.
customer_reviews.author: william mcdonough

customer_reviews.title: More effective than 100% foam
customer_reviews.text: I've used these at the gym after "graduating" from softer, standard (100% foam) foam rollers. I bought this 26" model because I have serious lower back issues, and for me this roller is far more effective than the standard foam roller (which I also own) for reducing lower back pain. It also works great for arms legs, shoulders etc. as well. Most gyms have these, and if you're able to I recommend trying one out before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: EdWC

customer_reviews.title: Indescribable
customer_reviews.text: This foam roller was bought for my husband for Christmas but the entire family has adopted it. The process is painful but it definitely works. The different grid marks tend to act as thumbs or the grooves feel like palms grinding into your muscles. The foam roller itself is the best quality I have seen around and doesn't look like it will be breaking anytime soon. My husband is a bodybuilder and he not only uses it without a problem but loves to use it on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Used this for the first time— I’ll admit it was painful, but my quads felt 99% better after two ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so tight after cycling this morning that I thought I’d be stuck on the couch recovering. Used this for the first time— I’ll admit it was painful, but my quads felt 99% better after two minutes of rolling. My husband was sceptical so I made him try it— we are hooked. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Renee' Havener

customer_reviews.title: Great, but I need a 36" model.
customer_reviews.text: Best "foam" roller that I've used, the plastic core is the reason for that. The only issue I find with this product is that it isn't 36 inches instead of 26 inches, and TriggerPoint doesn't offer a longer roller. Some back exercises require a roller that runs from head to tailbone, so what I do is I combine this one and the shorter one, but it'd be nice to have a larger option.
customer_reviews.author: At Home

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Nice and firm, but soft enough to not be uncomfortable. If you want a great foam roller, you've found it here.
customer_reviews.author: Broc

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses it for pain relief and muscle relax. So far as she told me, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Y

customer_reviews.title: Stuff Muscles beware
customer_reviews.text: Have stiff ached muscles? Stiff back? Roll it out. Triggerpoint makes awesome stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jared R. Bradley

product_meta.title: TriggerPoint GRID Foam Roller with Free Online Instructional Videos, 2.0 (26-inch)
feature_bullets: Patented foam roller design offers a superior, multi-density exterior constructed over a rigid, hollow core
Constructed from quality materials that won't break down or lose shape from repeated use
Includes access to free online instructional video library on foam rolling best practices from the experts at TriggerPoint
Trusted foam roller of physical and massage therapists, coaches, trainers and athletes
GRID 2.0: Standard density, 26 x 5.5 inches, 500 pound weight limit; 1 year manufacturer's warranty
